Posts.Content: And so would I. For some reason hormone therapy does not appear to be on the treatment menu for Cancer in some parts of Canada. As you can see from my bio(below), I have had experience with it in my treatment for prostate cancer, but that was because it was recommended by the Brachy ONCO doing my treatment. Anyway, I would also appreciate any information as well.
Posts.Title: Experience with "Hormone Therapy?"

Posts.Content: 395 views and no replies.....I guess this forum is not near as active as the Prostate Cancer forum.
Posts.Title: Experience with "Hormone Therapy?"

Posts.Content:
Thanks M.......I did update one of the active threads on the PC forum with a question to one of the guys who's wife is on HT.....I'll let you know what he comes back with.
GlennK
Posts.Title: Experience with "Hormone Therapy?"

Posts.Content: Wow, 588 views and no updates from anyone here.....I find it hard to believe that no one has any comment or advice to offer. I was hoping to have some information to offer my Mother-inlaw to encourage her to join this group to share stories and information.
Posts.Title: Memory Cancer

Posts.Content:
I wondered about
 the HT. Is that an option with chemo treatments?
Posts.Title: Memory Cancer

Posts.Content:
My mother-in-law was recently diagnosed with breast cancer and had a mastectomy done and her surgeon advised her that everything went well and her post treatment should be minimal. However, when she visited her oncologist she was pretty well in shock after receiving the news about
 her aggressive treatments for the next 5 years. I don't have all the details yet but I did hear some references to memory Cancer, H 2 protien , lobes , ducts and herceptin. 
Can anyone share similar experiences or point me in the right direction for some background information?
Posts.Title: Memory Cancer
